name: TriggerAnotherBuildXPlat
author: megoels
helpMarkDown: Replace with markdown to show in help

inputs.name: BuildDefinitionName
inputs.label: Build Definition Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the build definition name to be triggered.

inputs.name: definitionIsInCurrentTeamProject
inputs.label: Same Team Project (as this build)
inputs.helpMarkDown: True if the build to be triggered is in the same team project as this build.

inputs.name: teamProjectUri
inputs.label: Team Project URL (full URL)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The full URL of the team project which contians the build definition to be triggered, e.g: https://<ACCOUNTNAME>.visualstudio.com/DefaultCollection/<TEAMPROJECT>

inputs.name: customAuth
inputs.label: Custom Authentication (Endpoint)
inputs.helpMarkDown: Access the build api via custom Endpoint. Set it to false for bearer token authorization using the System.AccessToken variable.

inputs.name: connectedServiceName
inputs.label: Server Endpoint
inputs.helpMarkDown: The server generic endpoint, set the key -Password/Token Key- field to your API key.

inputs.name: triggerWithSourceVersion
inputs.label: Trigger with current Source Version
inputs.helpMarkDown: If this option is enabled, the triggered build will run with the same source version as the original build (Git: The commit ID. TFVC: the changeset).

inputs.name: triggerWithSourceBranch
inputs.label: Trigger with current Shelveset or Source Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Use this option for triggering the selected build with shelveset or same source branch as the original build.

inputs.name: customBranch
inputs.label: Custom Source Branch
inputs.helpMarkDown: Define the branch to the triggered build, for example: refs/heads/master.

inputs.name: parameters
inputs.label: Parameters
inputs.helpMarkDown: A comma-delimited list of parameters in the form of param1=value1;param2=value2;... this params will be passed to the triggered build variables.

inputs.name: demands
inputs.label: Demands
inputs.helpMarkDown: A comma-delimited list of demands in the form of capability1=value1;capability2=value2;... for example: KW=true;Protex=yes.

inputs.name: triggeredBuildId
inputs.label: Triggered Build ID Variable
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify the variable to hold the Build ID of the triggered build (name only without $). Keep it empty if it not needed.

inputs.name: multipleTriggers
inputs.label: Multiple Triggers
inputs.helpMarkDown: Triggers the same build according to multiple values of parameters (used for testing different numerical values).

inputs.name: multiParams
inputs.label: Multipliers Parameters (numerical values)
inputs.helpMarkDown: A list of comma separated parameters with range of values. For example param1=1-10;param2=3-4 triggers the selected build on each value of the parameters.

inputs.name: valuesRangeOnEachAgent
inputs.label: Trigger the values range on each Agent from the Pool
inputs.helpMarkDown: True=Trigger the same build on each Agent (which meets the specified demands) with each parameter value within the specified range, False=Trigger the range of the parameter values on Agents according to availability in Pool, if large range specified than the available Agents, some values will wait until an Agent completes running a previously assigned value.

inputs.name: waitForTriggeredBuild
inputs.label: Wait for completion
inputs.helpMarkDown: Wait for the triggered build to be finished.

inputs.name: timeout
inputs.label: Timeout [minutes]
inputs.helpMarkDown: Once timeout expired failing the triggering step and moving on to the next step.

inputs.name: registerToWait
inputs.label: Register to wait
inputs.helpMarkDown: Once this checked the triggered build will be added into wait list (for the Wait step).

inputs.name: waitTag
inputs.label: Wait Tag
inputs.helpMarkDown: Specify a custom tag for the Wait step, this tag can be used on the Wait step to determine wait list of triggered builds.

inputs.name: http_proxy
inputs.label: HTTP Proxy
inputs.helpMarkDown: If Agent is behind Proxy and there's no environment variable then you can provide it here

inputs.name: https_proxy
inputs.label: HTTPS Proxy
inputs.helpMarkDown: If Agent is behind Proxy and there's no environment variable then you can provide it here
